column4: ok i had linuxmint 10 gnome installed, and i was going to put windows on my hard drive then reinstall linuxmint well my external usb that had windows crashed on me a minute ago and i formated my hdd already to ntfs is there anyway i can reset the hdd back to the original state it was in before i formated it?
Unlikely. Unless you have some incredibly advanced technology not available on the commercial market. Government stuff e.g.
I wish I could be a better help.
lucky i backed up home folder first.
im at the install and it shows /dev/sda1 fat 32 248gb then it shows my linuxmint /dev/sda2 ext 4 251gb on my hard drive.
so does that mean it is still there?
Have you tried browsing through the folders to see if any files exist?
i cd'd into it but said not there
Yeah, doesn't exist. I don't know how to refresh it through. I'm new to Ubuntu.
bash: cd: /dev/sda2: No such file or directory
You're good. I'm sorry I couldn't be more helpful.
this is the fun part is installing it and having it download packages as it installs. =p
there is man crontab once you have it installed.
